pullRequest.title: [BC-298] Rework ChainStorageClient initialization
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR Description
Update ChainStorageClient to handle its own initialization.  Previously BeaconChainController would listen for a Store to be posted from the ChainStorageServer, which it would then use to initialize the ChainStorageClient:

BeaconChainController now receives a SafeFuture<ChainStorageClient> that completes once the client is initialized from storage.  BeaconChainController currently blocks waiting for the client to initialize.

This necessitates that the ChainStorageService be set up first so that any ChainStorageClient's that are created can be initialized.  This will be reworked in a follow up PR to clean up service startup logic.



Removing BeaconChainController from the initialization process means that the ChainStorageClient may be initialized without setting the "best block", as a result getBestBlockRoot() and getBestBlockState() now return Optional's.  This has resulted in a few additional changes:

We have a new ChainStorageClient.subscribeBestBlockInitialized method for subscribers who need to run logic once the best block is initialized
The ArtemisNode acceptance test utility has been updated to account for the fact that we now need to wait for the head block to be set

Additional fixes include:

Handling starting up from disk when the database is empty
Ensuring the ChainStorageClient.Store is only ever set once

commit.message: Make bestBlockRoot and bestBlockState getters return Optional's
Handle starting up from an existing, but empty database
Update acceptance test dsl to account for lag in setting chain head

Update storageBackedClient() factory to return a future

Move storage-backed initialization logic to a separate factory class.
Fix getBestBlockRootState() - use lambda, not method reference
Make sure we run store initialization logic even if we miss the event
Add some more test assertions to ChainStorageClientTest
We should be able to set up an initial state as long as store is null

nodes.bodyText: We should probably be using fetchBeaconHead here rather than waitForBeaconHead. Otherwise we're effectively nesting a waiter inside a waiter.  It will work but failure times become a lot longer unnecessarily.

Probably should use fetchChainHead here inside the waiter.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    () -> assertThat(waitForChainHead().finalized_epoch).isNotEqualTo(startingFinalizedEpoch),
          
          
            
                    () -> assertThat(fetchChainHead().finalized_epoch).isNotEqualTo(startingFinalizedEpoch),
Nice to be using real data structures instead of mocking them.
Not a big deal but I think I preferred the initializeFromGenesis naming because it doesn't feel like it quite matches the pattern of a setter (particularly that it can't be called multiple times).
Nice to see these becoming Optional instead of returning null.
I like specifically requesting the store instead of it just magically being fired at startup.  Should be even nicer when we get to convert this over to EventChannels.

commit.message: Always post an event when ChainStorageServer starts up
